inclusion.criterion: Participants will be recruited for a period of 8 months with the expectation to enroll 15 women.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: The women who consent to participate in the study will be given a set of questionnaires at the time of consent and asked to complete by the next session.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Consenting patient will undergo an internal and external pelvic floor muscle examination. These procedures will be performed by the investigator.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The educational class will focus on the anatomy of the pelvic floor, physiology of urination, urinary incontinence, behavioral modifications in bladder training, dietary impact on bladder function, and performance of pelvic floor muscle exercises.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: The exercise class will have an emphasis on pelvic floor exercises, core exercises, and general body conditioning.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: An external and internal pelvic floor muscle examination will be performed after the intervention, prior to discharge to next level of care.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: All intervention will be performed while the patient is in the hospital, and no follow-up visits will be required.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Participants will not be compensated for this study.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Staff nurses, resident physicians, attending physicians, nurse practitioners, physical or occupational therapists will inform investigator of any patient self-reports of incontinence by women admitted to the 4th floor nursing unit during initial evaluations or any other time during their stay.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The staff member will explain the study to the woman, and she will be asked if the study investigator could come and discuss the possibility of enrolling in this study.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The investigator will approach every woman referred to the study and will explain the study in more detail. Participants will be asked to sign the consent form if they agree to participate and allow collection of personal health information.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Analysis Following HIPPA guidelines, patient identifiable data will be coded to protect each patient's identity. The data obtained from the patients will be entered onto electronic teleforms and imported into the database.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: We will run descriptive analyses to characterize the patients in the study. We will report the percent of patients who indicate they were satisfied with the program.
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient has a history of hypertension, hyperlipidemia, and hypothyroidism. He smokes 1 pack per day for 40 years and consumes 5-6 beers per week. He is not aware of his family history.
